products.name: OncoEMR (Flatiron OncoCloud suite)
products.description: Cloud-based oncology-specific EHR for community oncology and hematology practices. Core module of the broader OncoCloud/OncologyCloud suite which includes OncoBilling, OncoAnalytics/Flatiron Insight, Flatiron Assist (clinical decision support), OncoAir (mobile), CareSpace (patient portal), and formerly OncoTrials (clinical research, sold to Paradigm Health Dec 2025). Used by 4,500+ clinicians across 500+ cancer centers. Independent affiliate of Roche Group since 2018.
products.broader_product_name: Flatiron OncoCloud / OncologyCloud (includes OncoEMR, OncoBilling, OncoAnalytics/Flatiron Insight, Flatiron Assist, OncoAir, CareSpace patient portal)
products.notes: EHI export relies on Snowflake, AWS Aurora PostgreSQL, and AWS S3 — suggesting a data warehouse architecture rather than direct database export. 1,800+ live interfaces with 150+ unique healthcare vendors. Flatiron also runs a major real-world evidence (RWE) business using de-identified data from OncoEMR installations (5M+ patient records). OncoTrials clinical research component was sold to Paradigm Health in Dec 2025.

products.name: OneOncology HIE Integration
products.description: Integration/export layer built on top of OncoEMR to satisfy ONC EHI export requirements for OneOncology network practices. OneOncology is a network of independent community oncology practices (launched 2018, backed by General Atlantic) that uses Flatiron's technology stack. This product is certified only for (b)(10) EHI export plus security criteria — it is not a standalone EHR. Certification page explicitly states 'Additional Software Used: OncoEMR'.
products.broader_product_name: OneOncology platform (powered by Flatiron Health OncoEMR)
products.notes: Very new certification (May 2025, v1.0). Purpose-built compliance tool for EHI export. OneOncology has its own CTO (Andy Corts) indicating organizational independence from Flatiron. The data exported likely mirrors OncoEMR's data model since it depends on OncoEMR as underlying software. Key question: does this export cover the same scope as OncoEMR's own (b)(10) export, or is it a separate/different export for network-level data?

notes: Flatiron Health was acquired by Roche for $1.9B in 2018 and operates as an independent affiliate. OneOncology is a separate entity (practice network) that uses Flatiron technology — the developer listing 'Flatiron Health, OneOncology, LLC' reflects this joint arrangement. In Dec 2025, Paradigm Health acquired Flatiron's Clinical Research business (OncoTrials), narrowing Flatiron's focus to EHR, decision support, analytics, and RWE. The OncoCloud suite (OncoEMR + OncoBilling + OncoAnalytics + Flatiron Assist + CareSpace portal + OncoAir mobile) represents the full product footprint for EHI purposes.
